title: Man shot to death in drive-by in Cleveland's Fairfax neighborhood
content:
(File photo)
CLEVELAND, Ohio - Cleveland homicide detectives are investigating Friday night after a man was shot to death on the city's East Side.
The shooting occurred about 7:30 p.m. near the intersection of East 80th Street and Cedar Avenue in Cleveland's Fairfax neighborhood, Cleveland police spokeswoman Sgt. Jennifer Ciaccia said. A 33-year-old man suffered several gunshot wounds.
He was taken to University Hospitals by Cleveland EMS, where he was pronounced dead, Ciaccia said.
The Cuyahoga County Medical Examiner's Office will identity the victim and determine his official cause of death.
During their preliminary investigation, officers learned that the shots were fired from a vehicle. However, neither the vehicle's make nor model has been identified.
Around the same time of the fatal shooting, police received a call of shots fired into a home on the 7900 block of Golden Avenue - just blocks away from where the man was mortally wounded, Ciaccia said. One bullet traveled through an upstairs window, shattering the glass.
A 2-year-old girl suffered bruises to her chest during the shooting incident on Golden Avenue, Ciaccia said. She was taken to Rainbow Babies & Children's Hospital, where she is expected to be treated and released.
Cleveland detectives continue to work to determine if the two shootings are related, Ciaccia said.
No suspects have been identified, and no arrests have been made.
If you'd like to comment on this post, please visit the cleveland.com crime and courts comments section.
